page.title: 03A DAIRY FARMER'S DAY
page.content: Dad gets up first and fetches the cows. He brings them into the yard and then through the entrance door of the milking parlour. When they have been milked, they go out of another door. The milk goes through some pipes into the storage tank, from which the milk tanker will collect it. The milk collected in the morning goes to the Milk Marketing Board. We deliver the evening milk the following morning. When we get back from the milk round, we wash the bottles so that they will be clean for the bottling. Dad does the milking in the evening and Mum bottles it. The milk comes from the cow, through pipes and tanks, down to the bottles. Five bottles are filled at once, and a crate holds twenty bottles. The crates are put in the fridge overnight ready for the milkround in the morning
